using Ubuntu, and looking for a way to change the default boot OS, when it starts.
You need to change the default in the /boot/grub/menu.lst file
- You will see that it is the file that defines the grub menu screen.  It is in ubuntu, under /boot/grub

The "0" in "default           0" means to use the first choice in the list.  Look down further in the list and you will see the different kernels and OS's.  0 is for the first, 1 for the second, and so on.  Change "default       0" to "default    3" or wehatever you want
Look down to the line ## ## End default options ## ##
The little paragraphs that start after that are separate listings in the grub menu you see on boot-up
- as far as I know thats the only way to test grub
- I hope you are listing ubuntu as the new default (j/k  =)
You need to edit with sudo.  Instead of "gedit menu.lst", type "sudo gedit menu.lst"
